title: Emily Lloyd spotted in public for the first time with her daughter
title_page: Emily Lloyd spotted in public for the first time with her daughter  | Daily Mail Online
text:
Actress Emily Lloyd was seen enjoying a cigar as she was spotted in public with her one-year-old daughter for the first time at the weekend.
The 45-year-old's low-key outing in East London came a week before the second anniversary of her actor father Roger Lloyd-Pack’s death.
Lloyd-Pack lost his long battle with pancreatic cancer on January 15 2014. He was best known for his role as dim-witted Trigger in the BBC comedy Only Fools and Horses.
Actress Emily Lloyd was seen enjoying a cigar as she was spotted in public with her one-year-old daughter for the first time. The 45-year-old strolled along the pavement towards a local park with her baby Arabelle
Trip to the park: Her outing in East London (left) came a week before the second anniversary of the death of her actor father Roger Lloyd-Pack. Lloyd-Pack lost his long battle with pancreatic cancer on January 15 2014
The popular actor's daughter was seen strolling along the pavement towards a local park with her baby Arabelle in a pushchair.
It is the first time she and her baby have been pictured in public since her only child with singer Christian Jupp was born.
She spoke last year of her regret that Lloyd-Pack never got to meet the little girl.
Lloyd, who shot to fame at 16 in David Leyland’s 1987 dramady Wish You Were Here, told the Sunday People: 'Having children wasn’t anything I ever ­discussed with Dad but having something positive to focus on helped in some way after his death.
'However, at the same time there is sadness that he isn’t here to enjoy her. Sometimes I wish I could share her with him but I can’t.'
When Lloyd-Pack died at the age of 69 it was a devastating blow for his daughter. Lloyd, who acted alongside Brad Pitt and Bruce Willis, saw her career struggle as she battled years of depression and anxiety.
The actress spoke last year of her regret that Lloyd-Pack (pictured together) never got to meet her little girl
Back in the day: She is pictured, left, arriving at the Odeon Haymarket in central London for the premiere of David Leyland’s 1987 dramady Wish You Were Here and, right, attending the Cannes Film Festival
Actress: Lloyd (pictured in 1987) shot to fame at the age of 16 in David Leyland’s Wish You Were Here
But she spoke in May 2015 of how motherhood had helped her turn a corner and made her problems 'fade into the background'.
Lloyd, who was once diagnosed with mild schizophrenia and has needed specialist psychiatric care, said last year in the Sunday People interview: 'I have had my problems over the years but having a baby to care for puts everything into perspective.'
The actress was introduced to Jupp, who used to be the vocalist in the Flying Medallions, through a mutual friend. He later worked as a painter/decorator.
